definition: lit. to become lost in a fog (idiom); fig. at a complete loss
as if degenerating into smoke (idiom); ignorant and unable to see where things are heading

sentences.english: For some ten days , my heart suddenly perceived that its person was unapt to degenerate yet .
sentences.chinese: 有这么十余天来，我心中忽觉到了自己的不至腐堕。

sentences.english: Beware that wealth rarely lasts and power often corrupts.
sentences.chinese: 警惕富贵不出三代，小心权势令人堕落。

sentences.english: Consequently can break settle, her Duo dead height, above at least in the 6 F.
sentences.chinese: 因此可以断定，她的堕死高度，至少在六层以上。

sentences.english: The Leaves of Life keeps falling one by one.
sentences.chinese: 生命的绿叶叶叶地飘堕不停。

sentences.english: And when the tail led, the snake fell into a burning pit and was burnt to its death.
sentences.chinese: 放尾在前，即堕火坑，烧烂而死。

sentences.english: I dream of a fall in the wake of this stubborn.
sentences.chinese: 我在这场梦中一堕不醒执迷不悟。
